question: This is a great [MASK], to be born with a head which is too quick.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: It was that the learning was too easy.
next_sentence: It is not good to be       different from our brothers, but it is evil to be superior to       them.

question: We had touched no [MASK], made no fire.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: We could not       conceive of that which we had created.
next_sentence: Yet here was light, light that came from nowhere,       light from the heart of metal.

question: We wanted to leap to our feet, as we have had to leap every morning of our life, but we [MASK] suddenly that no bell had rung and that there was no bell to ring anywhere.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: We awoke when a ray of sunlight fell across our face.
next_sentence: We lay on our back, we threw       our arms out, and we looked up at the sky.

question: We went on, without thought, without care, with nothing to feel save the song of our [MASK].
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: The forest seemed to welcome us.
next_sentence: We stopped when we felt hunger.

question: We must not keep our secret to ourselves, nor [MASK] under the ground.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: Our discovery is too great for us       to waste our time in sweeping the streets.
next_sentence: We must bring       it into the sight of all men.

question: Your head is high, but our [MASK] cringe.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: Your mouth is cut of granite, but our brothers are soft and       humble.
next_sentence: You walk, but       our brothers crawl.

question: Then, tonight, we [MASK] that we must escape.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: We counted each day and each night as it passed.
next_sentence: For tomorrow the World Council of       Scholars is to meet in our City.

question: The trees parted before us, [MASK] us forward.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: We       went on, cutting through the branches, and it was as if we were       swimming through a sea of leaves, with the bushes as waves rising       and falling and rising around us, and flinging their green sprays       high to the treetops.
next_sentence: The forest seemed to welcome us.

question: These things [MASK] us in our work.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: We found wires that led to strange little globes of       glass on the walls; they contained threads of metal thinner than       a spiderâs web.
next_sentence: We do not understand them, but       we think that the men of the Unmentionable Times had known our       power of the sky, and these things had some relation to it.

question: The forest rose among cliffs, and whenever we walked out upon a barren stretch of rock we saw great peaks before us in the west, and to the north of us, and to the south, as far as our [MASK] could see.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: For many days we had been       crossing a chain of mountains.
next_sentence: The peaks were red and       brown, with the green streaks of forests as veins upon them, with       blue mists as veils over their heads.

question: We picked a stone and we [MASK] it as an arrow at a bird.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: We saw birds in the tree       branches, and flying from under our footsteps.
next_sentence: It fell before us.

question: We learned that the earth is flat and that the sun [MASK] around it, which causes the day and the night.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: And we learned much from our Teachers.
next_sentence: We learned the names of       all the winds which blow over the seas and push the sails of our       great ships.

question: For in the temple of his [MASK], each man is alone.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: And we shall join our       hands when we wish, or walk alone when we so desire.
next_sentence: Let each man keep his       temple untouched and undefiled.

question: So we sit under the earth and we [MASK] the stolen scripts.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: Manuscripts are rare and they are kept in the Home of the       Scholars.
next_sentence: Two years have passed since we found this place.

question: We [MASK] to count the blows, but we lost count.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: The lash whistled like a singing wind.
next_sentence: We knew that the blows were falling       upon our back.

question: They [MASK] before us and they did not move.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: They seemed older than the marble of the Temple of the World       Council.
next_sentence: And we saw no       breath to stir the folds of their white togas.

question: Some crumbled to [MASK] as we touched them.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: For they were not white tunics, nor white togas; they were       of all colors, no two of them alike.
next_sentence: But others were of heavier cloth, and they felt       soft and new in our fingers.

question: Two men stood by the post, naked but for leather aprons and [MASK] hoods over their faces.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: This room has no windows and it is empty save for an       iron post.
next_sentence: Those who had brought       us departed, leaving us to the two Judges who stood in a corner       of the room.

question: And when we put our wires to this box, when we [MASK] the currentâthe wire glowed!
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: We shall be forgiven for anything       we say tonight....        Tonight, after more days and trials than we can count, we       finished building a strange thing, from the remains of the       Unmentionable Times, a box of glass, devised to give forth the       power of the sky of greater strength than we had ever achieved       before.
next_sentence: It came to life, it turned red, and a       circle of light lay on the stone before us.

question: The flame of the [MASK] stands still in the air.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: It is dark here.
next_sentence: Nothing moves in this tunnel save our hand on the paper.

question: Our face was not like the faces of our brothers, for we [MASK] not pity when looking upon it.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: For our face and our body       were beautiful.
next_sentence: Our body was not like       the bodies of our brothers, for our limbs were straight and thin       and hard and strong.

question: And then we saw iron rings as steps leading down a shaft into a [MASK] without bottom.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: But we pulled at the grill and       it gave way.
next_sentence: âWe shall go down,â we said to International 4-8818.        âIt is forbidden,â they answered.

question: They leapt to their feet, they ran from the table, and they stood [MASK] against the wall, huddled together, seeking the warmth of one anotherâs bodies to give them courage.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: But terror struck the men of the Council.
next_sentence: We looked upon them and we laughed and said:        âFear nothing, our brothers.

question: We [MASK] to it, we fell upon it, our face in our arms, and we lay still.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: Our glass box lay beside us.
next_sentence: We lay thus for a long time.

question: It happened on that [MASK] when we wrote last.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: We had been caught.
next_sentence: We forgot, that night, to watch the       sand in the glass which tells us when three hours have passed and       it is time to return to the City Theatre.

question: All men [MASK] it and none dare to speak.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: Fear walks through the City, fear without       name, without shape.
next_sentence: We feel it also, when we are in the Home of the Street Sweepers.

question: They raised their hand to their [MASK] and moved it as we had.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: But Liberty 5-3000 saw it and       understood.
next_sentence: Thus, each day, we greet Liberty 5-3000, and they       answer, and no men can suspect.

question: So we walked on, our box in our arms, our [MASK] empty.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: Only we wished to be away, away from the City       and from the air that touches upon the air of the City.
next_sentence: We are doomed.

question: And both these joys belong to us alone, they come from us alone, they [MASK] no relation to all our brothers, and they do not concern our brothers in any way.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: But the only things which       taught us joy were the power we created in our wires, and the       Golden One.
next_sentence: Thus do we wonder.

question: We care not about our [MASK], but our light is ...
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: They       would see nothing, save our crime of working alone, and they       would destroy us and our light.
next_sentence: Yes, we do care.

question: The trees had protected it from time and weather, and from men who have less pity than [MASK] and weather.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: We both knew it without words: this house was left from the       Unmentionable Times.
next_sentence: We turned to the Golden One and we asked:        âAre you afraid?â        But they shook their head.

question: Then we knew suddenly that we were lying on a [MASK] earth and that we had stopped.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: We knew only that we must run, run to       the end of the world, to the end of our days.
next_sentence: Trees taller than we had ever seen before stood       over us in great silence.

question: We must bring it into the [MASK] of all men.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: We must not keep our       secret to ourselves, nor buried under the ground.
next_sentence: We need all our time, we need the       work rooms of the Home of the Scholars, we want the help of our       brother Scholars and their wisdom joined to ours.

question: This have we been [MASK] with our first breath.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: Everything which       comes from one is evil.
next_sentence: We have broken the law, but we have never doubted it.

question: On the [MASK] there were long thin tracks of iron, but it was not iron; it felt smooth and cold as glass.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: Its walls were hard and smooth to the       touch; it felt like stone, but it was not stone.
next_sentence: We knelt, and we crawled forward, our       hand groping along the iron line to see where it would lead.

question: They [MASK] the bag of seeds, and they threw the seeds into the furrows of earth as they walked away.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: Then three of the sisters in the field appeared, coming toward       the road, so the Golden One walked away from us.
next_sentence: But the seeds flew wildly, for the hand of       the Golden One was trembling.

question: And our glass box stood before us on the cold [MASK], as we had left it.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: We lit the candle and we saw that our place had not been found       and nothing had been touched.
next_sentence: What matter they now, the       scars upon our back!

question: Then we thought of the meaning of that which [MASK] before us.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: We could not       see our body nor feel it, and in that moment nothing existed save       our two hands over a wire glowing in a black abyss.
next_sentence: We       can light our tunnel, and the City, and all the Cities of the       world with nothing save metal and wires.

question: And it will become as the heart of the earth, lost and hidden at first, but beating, beating [MASK] each day.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: Here on this mountain, I and my sons and my chosen friends shall       build our new land and our fort.
next_sentence: And word of it will reach every corner of the       earth.

question: We stood [MASK] for a long time.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: The Golden One breathed once, and their breath       was a moan, and then their arms closed around us.
next_sentence: And we were frightened that we       had lived for twenty-one years and had never known what joy is       possible to men.

question: We stopped and we [MASK] that their eyes, so hard and scornful to the world, were looking at us as if they would obey any word we might speak.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: But the       Golden One stood alone at the hedge, waiting.
next_sentence: And we said:        âWe have given you a name in our thoughts, Liberty 5-3000.â        âWhat is our name?â they asked.

question: Rather shall we be [MASK] with you than good with all our brothers.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: But if you wish it so, we shall       obey you.
next_sentence: May the Council have mercy upon both our hearts!â        Then we walked away together and back to the Home of the Street       Sweepers.

question: As the [MASK] rose, a thing happened which no eyes saw but ours, else we would not be living today.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: And we thought       then, standing in the square, that the likeness of a Saint was       the face we saw before us in the flames, the face of the       Transgressor of the Unspeakable Word.
next_sentence: Perhaps it had only seemed to       us.

question: The fortune of my spirit is not to be blown into coins of brass and [MASK] to the winds as alms for the poor of the spirit.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: I do not surrender my treasures, nor do I share them.
next_sentence: I guard my       treasures: my thought, my will, my freedom.

question: The evil of our crime is not for the [MASK] mind to probe.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: We alone, of       the thousands who walk this earth, we alone in this hour are       doing a work which has no purpose save that we wish to do it.
next_sentence: The nature       of our punishment, if it be discovered, is not for the human       heart to ponder.

question: We know not whether they [MASK] at us also, but we think they did.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: And there we looked at Liberty 5-3000 each day.
next_sentence: Then one day they came close to the hedge, and suddenly they       turned to us.

question: And the [MASK] of water falling from their hands, as they raised the water to their lips, were like sparks of fire in the sun.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: The Golden One were kneeling alone       at the moat which runs through the field.
next_sentence: Then the Golden One saw us,       and they did not move, kneeling there, looking at us, and circles       of light played upon their white tunic, from the sun on the water       of the moat, and one sparkling drop fell from a finger of their       hand held as frozen in the air.

question: Let us throw away our candles and our [MASK].
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: Let us all work together, and harness this power, and       make it ease the toil of men.
next_sentence: Let us flood our cities with light.

question: It may wear chains, but it will [MASK] through.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: It may sleep, but it will awaken.
next_sentence: And man will go on.

question: All is not well with our [MASK].
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: Yet our brothers are not like us.
next_sentence: There are Fraternity 2-5503, a quiet boy with wise,       kind eyes, who cry suddenly, without reason, in the midst of day       or night, and their body shakes with sobs they cannot explain.

question: We counted each day and each night as it [MASK].
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: And they       departed.
next_sentence: Then, tonight,       we knew that we must escape.

question: What is my joy if all hands, even the unclean, can [MASK] into it?
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: It is the       word by which the depraved steal the virtue of the good, by which       the weak steal the might of the strong, by which the fools steal       the wisdom of the sages.
next_sentence: What is my wisdom, if even the fools can dictate to me?

question: We knelt by the [MASK] and we bent down to drink.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: It lay so still that we saw no water       but only a cut in the earth, in which the trees grew down,       upturned, and the sky lay at the bottom.
next_sentence: And then we stopped.

question: We do not [MASK] why we think of them.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: It is our second       Transgression of Preference, for we do not think of all our       brothers, as we must, but only of one, and their name is Liberty       5-3000.
next_sentence: We do not know why,       when we think of them, we feel all of a sudden that the earth is       good and that it is not a burden to live.

question: Of a sudden the earth fell in before us, and we saw an old iron grill over a [MASK] hole.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: So we called International       4-8818, and together we scraped the earth around the bar.
next_sentence: International 4-8818 stepped back.

question: There was more [MASK] than wall upon its walls, and the windows went on straight around the corners, though how this kept the house standing we could not guess.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: The house had two stories and a strange roof flat as a floor.
next_sentence: The walls were hard and       smooth, of that stone unlike stone which we had seen in our       tunnel.

question: We came to know that we had found the greatest [MASK] on earth.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: We worked with it, we tested it in more ways than we       can describe, and each step was as another miracle unveiling       before us.
next_sentence: For it defies all the laws known to men.

question: We shall not share it with [MASK], as we share not our joy with them, nor our love, nor our hunger.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: This is       your house, Golden One, and ours, and it belongs to no other men       whatever as far as the earth may stretch.
next_sentence: So be it to the end of our days.â        âYour will be done,â they said.

question: And we have discovered it alone, and we alone are to [MASK] it.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: PART THREE        We, Equality 7-2521, have discovered a new power of nature.
next_sentence: It is said.

question: This word must never be placed [MASK] within manâs soul, else it becomes a monster, the root of all the evils on earth, the root of manâs torture by men, and of an unspeakable lie.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: For the word âWeâ must never be spoken, save by oneâs choice and       as a second thought.
next_sentence: The word âWeâ is as lime poured over men, which sets and hardens       to stone, and crushes all beneath it, and that which is white and       that which is black are lost equally in the grey of it.

question: The fires smoulder as a [MASK] of jewels around us, and smoke stands still in the air, in columns made blue by the moonlight.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: We can see their eyes, green and yellow as coals,       watching us from the tree branches beyond.
next_sentence: We sleep together in the       midst of the ring, the arms of the Golden One around us, their       head upon our breast.

question: We watch the leaf which has [MASK] upon their shoulder, and it lies at the curve of their neck, and a drop of dew glistens upon it like a jewel.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: The skin of their arms is like a blue mist, but their       shoulders are white and glowing, as if the light fell not from       above, but rose from under their skin.
next_sentence: They       approach us, and they stop, laughing, knowing what we think, and       they wait obediently, without questions, till it pleases us to       turn and go on.

question: Their eyes were dark and hard and glowing, with no fear in them, no [MASK] and no guilt.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: Their body was straight and thin as a blade of iron.
next_sentence: Their hair was golden as the sun; their       hair flew in the wind, shining and wild, as if it defied men to       restrain it.

question: [MASK] they turned as swiftly, and they walked away from us.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: But their face was taut, and their eyes were dark.
next_sentence: But the following day, when we came to the road, they smiled.

question: And above us the hole open upon the sky [MASK] smaller and smaller, till it came to be the size of a button.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: We could       see nothing below us.
next_sentence: But still we went down.

question: And as we look back upon our life, we see that it has ever been thus and that it has brought us step by step to our last, supreme transgression, our crime of crimes hidden here under the [MASK].
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: For we are not like our       brothers.
next_sentence: We remember the Home of the Infants where we lived till we were       five years old, together with all the children of the City who       had been born in the same year.

question: We have not many [MASK] to live.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: Why wonder about this?
next_sentence: We       are walking to the fangs awaiting us somewhere among the great,       silent trees.

question: And each [MASK] thereafter we knew the illness of waiting for our hour on the northern road.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: And the following day, as we came to the northern road, we kept       our eyes upon Liberty 5-3000 in the field.
next_sentence: And there we looked at Liberty 5-3000 each day.

question: Our [MASK] will be raised as a man.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: Gaea is       pregnant with my child.
next_sentence: He will       be taught to say âIâ and to bear the pride of it.

question: We found that it [MASK] lightning, and never have men known what causes lightning.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: It makes the       needle move and turn on the compass which we stole from the Home       of the Scholars; but we had been taught, when still a child, that       the loadstone points to the north and that this is a law which       nothing can change; yet our new power defies all laws.
next_sentence: In thunderstorms, we raised a tall rod of iron by the       side of our hole, and we watched it from below.

question: We [MASK] our eyes, for we could not see.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: Then our foot touched the ground.
next_sentence: Then our eyes became       used to the darkness, but we could not believe what we saw.

question: But then came the day when the sky turned white, as if the sun had burst and spread its flame in the air, and the fields lay still without breath, and the dust of the road was white in the [MASK].
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: PART FOUR        Many days passed before we could speak to the Golden One again.
next_sentence: So the women of the field were weary, and they tarried over       their work, and they were far from the road when we came.

question: We are alone here under the [MASK].
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: Nothing moves in this tunnel save our hand on the paper.
next_sentence: It is a fearful word, alone.

question: So when the oldest of them asked us: âWhere have you been? â we thought of our glass [MASK] and of our light, and we forgot all else.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: When the Council of the Home questioned us, we looked upon the       faces of the Council, but there was no curiosity in those faces,       and no anger, and no mercy.
next_sentence: And we answered:        âWe will not tell you.â        The oldest did not question us further.

question: No [MASK] stopped us at the gate.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: No men stopped us, for there were none about from the       Palace of Corrective Detention, and the others knew nothing.
next_sentence: We walked through empty passages and       into the great hall where the World Council of Scholars sat in       solemn meeting.

question: We know not why our curse [MASK] us seek we know not what, ever and ever.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: And questions give us no rest.
next_sentence: But we cannot resist it.

question: There is green mould in the grooves of the letters and [MASK] streaks on the marble, which come from more years than men could count.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: These words were cut long ago.
next_sentence: And these words are       the truth, for they are written on the Palace of the World       Council, and the World Council is the body of all truth.

question: We know these things, but we do not [MASK].
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: We have torn ourselves from the truth which is our       brother men, and there is no road back for us, and no redemption.
next_sentence: We care for nothing on       earth.

question: It was a long story, and the spirit which [MASK] it was the spirit of manâs freedom.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: I look upon the       history of men, which I have learned from the books, and I       wonder.
next_sentence: But what is freedom?

question: But we could not [MASK] our body.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: We looked upon two hands lying far before us on the bricks,       and we moved them, and we knew that they were our hands.
next_sentence: Then we smiled, for we thought of the       light and that we had not betrayed it.

question: But the following day, when we came to the road, they [MASK].
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: Then       they turned as swiftly, and they walked away from us.
next_sentence: They smiled to us and for us.

question: We say to ourselves that we are a wretch and a [MASK].
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: And yet there is no shame in us and no regret.
next_sentence: But we feel no       burden upon our spirit and no fear in our heart.

question: Our discovery is too great for us to waste our [MASK] in sweeping the streets.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: Then we knew what we must do.
next_sentence: We must not keep our       secret to ourselves, nor buried under the ground.

question: And we felt torn, torn for some word we could not [MASK].
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: âNo,â they whispered, âthat is not what we wished to say.â        They were silent, then they spoke slowly, and their words were       halting, like the words of a child learning to speak for the       first time:        âWe are one... alone... and only... and we love you who are       one... alone... and only.â        We looked into each otherâs eyes and we knew that the breath of a       miracle had touched us, and fled, and left us groping vainly.
next_sentence: PART TEN        We are sitting at a table and we are writing this upon paper made       thousands of years ago.

question: It is as if we were speaking [MASK] to no ears but our own.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: It       is base and evil.
next_sentence: And we know well that there is no transgression       blacker than to do or think alone.

question: Then our [MASK], losing all sense, rolled over and over on the moss, dry leaves in our tunic, in our hair, in our face.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: The branch       snapped under us and we fell upon the moss that was soft as a       cushion.
next_sentence: And       we heard suddenly that we were laughing, laughing aloud, laughing       as if there were no power left in us save laughter.

question: We put a [MASK] of copper and a piece of zinc into a jar of brine, we touched a wire to them, and there, under our fingers, was a miracle which had never occurred before, a new miracle and a new power.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: The       frog had been hanging on a wire of copper; and it had been the       metal of our knife which had sent the strange power to the copper       through the brine of the frogâs body.
next_sentence: This discovery haunted us.

question: We cannot [MASK] this new life which we have found, yet it seems so clear and so simple.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: The days before us       are without end, like the forest.
next_sentence: When questions come to puzzle us,       we walk faster, then turn and forget all things as we watch the       Golden One following.

question: Then he was [MASK] by the kings.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: But he broke their       chains.
next_sentence: But he broke their       chains.

question: Then our eyes became [MASK] to the darkness, but we could not believe what we saw.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: We rubbed our eyes, for we could not see.
next_sentence: No men known to us could have built this place, nor the men known       to our brothers who lived before us, and yet it was built by men.

question: Tomorrow, we shall begin to [MASK] these scripts.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: We glanced through       the pages, and we saw that they were written in our language, but       we found many words which we could not understand.
next_sentence: When we had seen all the rooms of the house, we looked at the       Golden One and we both knew the thought in our minds.

question: We walked on till the sun had [MASK].
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: And we thought that we could trust this       being who looked upon us from the stream, and that we had nothing       to fear with this being.
next_sentence: When the shadows gathered       among the trees, we stopped in a hollow between the roots, where       we shall sleep tonight.

question: The [MASK] before us are without end, like the forest.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: But we do not have to hasten.
next_sentence: We cannot understand this new life which we have found, yet it       seems so clear and so simple.

question: But tonight, for a reason we cannot fathom, we wish it were possible to us to [MASK] the likeness of our own person.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: Men never see       their own faces and never ask their brothers about it, for it is       evil to have concern for their own faces or bodies.
next_sentence: PART SIX        We have not written for thirty days.

question: We have no [MASK] of our brothers.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: There is no danger       in solitude.
next_sentence: Let us forget their       good and our evil, let us forget all things save that we are       together and that there is joy as a bond between us.

question: We are to give its [MASK], its highest meaning to all this glowing space of rock and sky.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: We are to speak.
next_sentence: We look ahead, we beg our heart for guidance in answering this       call no voice has spoken, yet we have heard.

question: âYour eyes are as a flame, but our brothers have neither [MASK] nor fire.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: You are damned, and we       wish to share your damnation.â        They looked upon us, and their voice was low, but there was       bitterness and triumph in their voice.
next_sentence: Your mouth is cut of granite, but our brothers are soft and       humble.

question: We made a fire, we cooked the bird, and we ate it, and no meal had ever tasted [MASK] to us.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: It fell before us.
next_sentence: And we thought suddenly that there was a       great satisfaction to be found in the food which we need and       obtain by our own hand.

question: We can see their eyes, green and yellow as coals, watching us from the [MASK] branches beyond.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: We sleep in the midst of that ring, and the beasts dare not       attack us.
next_sentence: The fires smoulder as       a crown of jewels around us, and smoke stands still in the air,       in columns made blue by the moonlight.

question: We come [MASK] to have our dinner, which lasts one hour.
title: Anthem
prev_sentence: In five hours, the       shadows are blue on the pavements, and the sky is blue with a       deep brightness which is not bright.
next_sentence: Then the bell rings and we walk in       a straight column to one of the City Halls, for the Social       Meeting.
